intro: Zeuxine elatior, commonly known as the tall zeuxine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow and are borne in clusters, making it visually striking in its natural habitat. Zeuxine elatior is often found in moist, rocky soils and thrives in cooler climates.
